skillTree.localised_description: Kurt Helborg rides into battle atop Krieglust, a massive grey gelding said to have been sired by the finest steed in the Emperor's stable.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: "Reiksguard Knights, your Emperor is calling! Death or glory await us, but if we die, we will die as warriors, with swords in hand, and there can be no better death than that." \\n—Kurt Helborg, The Reiksmarshal

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Imperial Foot and Greatswords
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +5% for Imperial Foot and Greatswords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It's said that an army marches on its stomach. The Reiksguard know how to keep an army marching.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost : -10% for State Troops
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: As he dealt with Marius Leitdorf in Averheim, Kurt Helborg is often sent to "assist" the elector counts.

As part of the Reiksguard and better organized than the reperguators, the Untersuchung brings together the conspiracy hunters. They investigate cults and illegal, subversive or plasphematory activities, essentially within the army or imperial court.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -8% when increasing
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: As a general, he is virtually without peer, leading entire armies of Knights in thunderous charges of gleaming plate armour and glistering lance points.

‘You come here,’ snarled the moustached warrior through gritted teeth, drawing himself up to his full height. ‘You bring the plague, you bring the fires, you bring the pain.’ His scarred face creased into an expression of pure, unadulterated hatred. ‘Now I bring the reckoning.’

effects.description:
Leadership: -5% fighting bretonnia
	(all units in army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!

As one, the Reiksguard knights spurred their mounts to a trot, heading straight at the Skaeling warriors. The line was packed so tightly that the flanks of each horse pressed against its neighbour’s. Helborg had drilled them to precision, and despite the broken ground each brother adjusted his pace instinctively to keep the line unbroken.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

Greater even than a Knight of the Inner Circle is the Grand Master, and it is he who commands a Knightly Order. A Grand Master is a warrior and leader of unparalleled valour, having fought in dozens of battles, and whose military prowess is beyond question. An Elector Count can request that a Knightly Order fight alongside his army, but the decision to ride out lies solely with the Grans Master. This makes the Grand Master a very powerful ally, and a great care is taken to not offend them.

skillTree.localised_description: ‘Brothers of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard, here stand before us those who would join our ranks. Each one, the eldest son of a most noble family, and able to bear arms. They have proven themselves of sufficient strength in body, mind and spirit. They have sworn to uphold our duties and they have pledged themselves to our cause without doubt, without condition, without restraint. Will you call them brother?’

effects.description:

	(local province)

Bonus vs Large: +10 for Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

items.colour_text: Grudge Settler, Solland's runefang, was later recovered by a joint expedition of Dwarfs and Men. Part of the Imperial treasury, the sword is currently used by Reiksmarshall Kurt Helborg.
The magic within the laurels magnifies Helborg stature in the eyes of his enemies to the point that few can muster the courage to stand before his wrath.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: As the Reiksmarshal, Kurt Helborg is the commander of all the Empire's armed forces, second only to the Emperor himself. As such, he has spent most of his life in battle, and has since become one of the most experienced generals within the Old World.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Empire Captains
	(local province)
